intro: Beilschmiedia pustulata, commonly known as the bumpy-fruit beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, warty, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife. Beilschmiedia pustulata typically grows in shaded, moist environments and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its unique fruit morphology and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
